docs.snippet: GENEVA, April 21--A series of agreements that will fix the tariff levels of the world's major trading countries for the next three years was opened for signature at Torquay, England, today, marking the official close of the second longest of three...
docs.lead_paragraph: GENEVA, April 21--A series of agreements that will fix the tariff levels of the world's major trading countries for the next three years was opened for signature at Torquay, England, today, marking the official close of the second longest of three post-war tariff conferences.
docs.abstract: 3 operative documents and 147 separate tariff pacts open for signature; conf officially ends; tariff truce to '54 seen for most of world

headline.main: TARIFF REDUCTIONS BRING TRADE TRUCE TO MUCH OF WORLD; Agreements to Be Signed in Torquay Are to Remain in Force Till 1954 U.S. ENTERING 15 PACTS 147 Sets of Negotiations Are Involved With Austria and Bonn Completing the Most

byline.original: By MICHAEL L. HOFFMAN Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, April 23-- Britain and Argentina signed a new meat agreement tonight that will soon give more beef to Britons. The agreement ends a ten-month deadlock over Argentine demands for higher prices.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, April 23-- Britain and Argentina signed a new meat agreement tonight that will soon give more beef to Britons. The agreement ends a ten-month deadlock over Argentine demands for higher prices.

headline.main: BRITAIN,ARGENTINA SIGN A MEAT PACT; 200,000 Tons Will Be Supplied United Kingdom at Higher Prices--Ration to Double
